Ron,
He has a lot of shinsa experience with both the NTHK and NBTHK (Hozon/Tokubetsu Hozon, Juyo and Tokubetsu Juyo teams).  I can't really pick out anything in particular.  He has judged plenty of signed kinko work, so I wouldn't worry.  In the few NTHK shinsa I've helped out at I've seen a fair amount of good, big name machibori kinko work pass shinsa (and of course gimei that have failed).  The Chicago shinsa is a great opportunity to have your pieces evaluated.
Jim



  Jim - I asked this earlier (maybe to Arnold, I don't recall), but what would be Hagihara sensei's strong points? 

  Ron
  STL
